nodes.text: President Bush attacked the Senate this week for having a  lousy record  of confirming his judicial nominees

The Democratic-controlled Senate confirmed 80 judges in its first 15 months in power - more than the Republican-led Senate confirmed in its final 30 months in control from 1999 through the summer of 2001
Bush is committed to the fact that in the past there has never been such a low number of judicial nominees
Bush was committed to the fact that the Republicans confirmed a lower number of judicial nominees than the Democrats did
It seems that Bush is manipulating the facts
Bush is the president and he must know the confirmations of judicial nominees
